issue.title: sub_match::swap only swaps the base class

discussion.p: sub_match<I> derives publicly from pair<I,I>, and so inherits pair::swap(pair&). This means that the following program fails:
The pair::swap(pair&) member should be hidden by a sub_match::swap(sub_match&) member that does the right thing.
discussion.note: 2019-06-12 Priority set to 3 after reflector discussion
2020-05-01; Daniel adjusts wording to recent working draft
2022-04-25; Daniel adjusts wording to recent working draft
discussion.p: In addition the revised wording uses the new standard phrase "The exception specification is equivalent to"

li.p: Modify , class template sub_match synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.blockquote: [Drafting note: The swappable requirement should really be unnecessary because Cpp17Iterator requires it, but there is no wording that requires BidirectionalIterator in Clause in general meets the bidirectional iterator requirements. Note that the definition found in does not extend to normatively. — end drafting note]

p.ins: -?- Preconditions: Lvalues of type BidirectionalIterator are swappable ().
-?- Remarks: The exception specification is equivalent to is_nothrow_swappable_v<BidirectionalIterator>.

discussion.p: With the informal acceptance of P2696R0 by LWG during a pre-Kona telecon, we should use the new requirement set Cpp17Swappable instead of the "LValues are swappable" requirements.
Set status to Tentatively Ready after six votes in favour during reflector poll.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to and assumes the acceptance of P2696R0.

li.p: Modify , class template sub_match synopsis, as indicated:

Note that the definition found in does not extend to normatively. — end drafting note]

p.ins: -?- Preconditions: BidirectionalIterator meets the Cpp17Swappable requirements ().
-?- Remarks: The exception specification is equivalent to is_nothrow_swappable_v<BidirectionalIterator>.
